page.title: 01Background to our block.
page.content: Our block is in a very rural part of the East Midlands.It is almost equally divided between Northamptonshire and Warwickshire.The block contains almost the whole of one very small village,a hamlet,and several isolated farmhouses. It contains some of the highest land in both counties.(Beacon Hill in the north of our block is 205m high). Of historical note are the moated church and an original fishpond of an ancient Priory at Lower Catesby.At Newbold is the site of a deserted medi- eval village. In the S.E.of the block,is one of the most important watersheds in the Mid- lands.From it,the Nene River flows east,the Leam flows north,and the Cher- well south to join the Thames. Our block is an important area for mixed farming.
